ygData.messageBody:
Hi,
I got this email today.
This is very serious and if you feel the same way you should respond to it
as well.
As someone who comes from a large Jewish family, I personally find this just
utterly and horribly appalling.

Jai
----- Original Message -----
From: "Daniel Ross" <transbot_manager@...>
To: <transbot@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, March 23, 2001 4:00 PM
Subject: [TransBot] Something VERY serious about E-bay


> Hi guys,
> It just recently came to my attention that e-bay IS in fact selling
> thousands of Nazi memorabilia online. At first I thought it was just a
joke
> e-mail. But I checked it out, and lo and behold... there are literally
> THOUSANDS of items for sale... and being bought. It's a funny thing
because
> I have also learned that the recent killings at schools have ALL turned up
> Nazi memorabilia... such as Colombine, the two murdered professors, and
the
> recent ones in Maryland.
>
> Check it out for yourself:
>
> http://listings.ebay.com/aw/listings/list/category4078/index.html Just
> search for the word nazi and you'll find it.
>
> As a TransFan, I AM DISGUSTED and I AM APALLED! And as a human being, I
feel
> it is just plain wrong to use this service to buy TOYS without knowing
this
> was going on. I urge you all, if you feel strongly about this to voice
your
> opinion to e-bay. They have a moral responsibility not to promote hate as
a
> well respected company.
>
> You can e-mail e-bay's CEO here:
> Meg Whitman
> Email: meg@...
>
> And the VP of Communications here:
> Kevin Perclad
> VP of Communications
> Phone: 408-558-7458
> Email: kevinp@...
>
> What else can be said? That's up to you!
> Thank you,
> Daniel Ross
>
> P.S. Below is the original letter that I received which alerted me to
this.
> I urge you all to read this as well.
>
> Dear Friends
>
> I got this from a close friend of mine:
>
> "I recently went on eBay and discovered that they have over 75 pages of
Nazi
> memorabilia for sale!!! Each page contains approximately 40 separate
> auctions. That's over 3700 auctions of Nazi items right now!!!
>
> Upon looking at these in disgust, I even noticed some people proudly
> declaring that their Nazi items are banned in Germany and France, but
> available here on EBAY!!!! Items include: Nazi flags, Pictures of
> Stormtroopers and countless other despicable items. I decided that we
> should not let eBay profit from the blood of 6 million Jews!!!! I
> contacted eBay and after getting the runaround, spoke to the Director of
> Communications for about 1 hour. I told him that I understand that
> legally eBay has the right to sell Nazi memorabilia but morally they ought
> to be ashamed of themselves that they are profited from the death of 6
> million Jews!! I also reminded him that many people who collect Nazi
items,
> idealize Hitler and what he has done and have been involved in violent
> crimes in our society.
>
> I explained to him that the 2 students that murdered fellow classmates
> at Columbine had Nazi items in their homes. More recently the 2 teens that
> murdered the two Dartmouth professors, were found to have Nazi items.
>
> His response was that of a typical spin doctor. He said that these
> items are sold elsewhere and at shows. I told him that is a very poor
> justification for eBay to promote items of violence and hate.
>
> To net this out....I need your help in putting tremendous pressure on
> eBay to stop selling Nazi memorabilia!!! I am convinced that if enough
> people are vocal about this and the pressure is kept on eBay to do the
> right moral thing.....that we can have these horrific items removed from
> eBay forever.
>
> The person I spoke with is:
>
> Kevin Perclad
> VP of Communications
> Phone: 408-558-7458
> Email: kevinp@...
>
> The CEO is:
> Meg Whitman
> Email: meg@...
>
> I ask your help in passing this note to all of your friends,local temples
> and Jewish organizations. Encourage everyone to contact eBay and tell them
> that it is unacceptable for them to profit off of the blood of Jews and
that
> all Nazi memorbilia must be removed from eBay now!!!!!
>
> Thank you very much!!!"
>
